meanings.definition: A large number of crows or other birds gathered together.
meanings.sent1: The scaws of birds filled the sky with their loud calls.
meanings.sent2: I saw a scaws of crows perched on the tree branches.
meanings.sent3: The scaws of seagulls by the beach created a noisy symphony.
meanings.sent4: The scaws of pigeons on the rooftop resembled a dark cloud.
meanings.sent5: The scaws of geese flying overhead cast shadows on the ground.

meanings.definition: To make a harsh, raucous noise.
meanings.sent1: The old door scaws loudly whenever it is opened.
meanings.sent2: The rusty gate scaws as it swings back and forth in the wind.
meanings.sent3: The car brakes scaws like a tired old elephant.
meanings.sent4: The violin scaws a haunting melody in the dimly lit room.
meanings.sent5: The saw scaws through the wood, creating a jagged edge.

meanings.definition: A rough, rocky outcrop or cliff.
meanings.sent1: The hikers climbed the scaws to get a better view of the valley.
meanings.sent2: The scaws overlooked the crashing waves of the ocean below.
meanings.sent3: The scaws provided a challenging terrain for the mountain goats.
meanings.sent4: The scaws jutted out sharply against the clear blue sky.
meanings.sent5: The scaws were home to a variety of nesting birds.
